intro: Conyza arabica, commonly known as goatweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and thrives in temperate to subtropical climates. It has a branched stem and produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Botanically, it belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
